measurements.id: Purified Water , Flow meter No. Fm-1010

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the reactor.
steps.remarks: Cleaned/Uncleaned

steps.description: Charge Purified Water (Lot-I) into the reactor.
steps.remarks: Vol: 2500L

steps.description: Charge GP HCI into the reactor under stirring.
steps.remarks: Stir for 20 to 30 minutes.

steps.description: Charge CS Lye (Lot-I) from the receiver SSRC-1010 to the reactor below 30°C.
steps.remarks: Temp: Vol: 190 L, Clear /Not Clear

steps.description: Charge Activated carbon slurry (Purified Water Lot-II + Activated carbon) into the reactor.
steps.remarks: Stir for 20 to 30 minutes.

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the reactor.Filter reaction mass through the filter setup (SSCF-1001,SSMF-1001&SSMF-1002). Initially re-circulate the mass for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.remarks: Solution : Clear/Unclear

steps.description: If found satisfactory, transfer the filtered mass to another clean reactor (GLRE 1014).
steps.remarks: After completion of filtration flush the filter setup with Nitrogen pressure.

steps.description: Charge Purified Water Lot-III into reactor.
steps.remarks: Transfer the Water through the filter setup into GLRE 1014.

steps.description: Slowly adjust the mass pH to 7.0 to 7.5 with filtered CS Lye (Lot-II) from receiver SSRC-1004 below 40℃.
Cool to below 5ºC.
steps.remarks: Maintain for 30 minutes at 30° C to 40°C.

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the Centrifuge.
steps.remarks: Cleaned/Uncleaned

steps.description: Load the Lot-I material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-II material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-III material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-IV material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-V material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-VI material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-VII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Load the Lot-VIII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
steps.remarks: Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3

steps.description: Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
steps.remarks: Vol : 100 L

steps.description: Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
steps.remarks: Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the reactor.
steps.remarks: Cleaned/Uncleaned

steps.description: Charge IPA (Lot-I) from receiver SSRC-1011 to reactor.
steps.remarks: Charge Methanol from receiver SSRC-1012 to reactor.

steps.description: Charge Purified Water (Lot-V) and stir for 15 to 30 minutes.
steps.remarks: Charge the GP Tech material into the reactor through PCS under stirring.

steps.description: Stir for 15 to 30 min.
steps.remarks: Raise the temperature to 40°C to 45°C.

steps.description: Maintain the temperature for 30 to 45 minutes an hour at 40°C to 45℃.
steps.remarks: Note; Record the temperature for every 10+5mintes.

steps.description: Cool the reaction mass 0°C to 5°C.
steps.remarks: Note: Record the temperature for every 30+5mintes.

steps.description: Maintain for 30 to 45 minutes at 0°C to 5°C.
steps.remarks: Check the cleanliness of the ANFD.

steps.description: Transfer the reaction mass from the reactor (GLRE-1015) to ANFD.
steps.remarks: Cleaned/Uncleaned

steps.description: Filter the mass by applying Nitrogen pressure to ANFD until removing the MLR to the collection tank SSST-1005.
steps.remarks: Wash the material with IPA (Lot-II) from the receiver SSRC-1011 to ANFD.

steps.description: Stir for 15 to 30 mins.
steps.remarks: Apply Nitrogen pressure for 3 to 5 hours. The ML's are collected into a collection tank SSST-1005

steps.description: Record Nitrogen pressure for every 60+ 10 min.
Release Nitrogen pressure and apply Vacuum
steps.remarks: Dry the material for 5 to 7 hours under vacuum.

steps.description: Note: SSANFD temperature should be below 45 ℃ and vacuum NLT 600 mmHg. Hot water temperature should be 50 to 60 ℃. Continue the vacuum drying till distillate is absent in view glass of the collection line.
steps.remarks: Record the Vacuum and temperature for every 60+10 minutes in the Temperature record sheet.

steps.description: Break the vacuum after completion of drying with nitrogen.
steps.remarks: Cool the material to below 30°C.

steps.description: Unload the material into the single poly bag into cleaned HDPE containers.
steps.remarks: Check the cleanliness of the SSRCVD & hopper.

steps.description: Charge material into SSRCVD.
steps.remarks: Cleaned/Uncleaned

steps.description: Close the manhole and rotate for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.remarks: Stop the SSRCVD and unload the material into a single poly bag HDPE containers.

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the Sifter & ensure the integrity of sieve and magnet
steps.remarks: Cleaned / Uncleaned- Integrity of Sieve & Magnet: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory

steps.description: Record tare weights of containers (HDPE/Fiber containers) including outer Black polythene bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag).
steps.remarks: Mesh No: 40 #

steps.description: Sieve the material through designated mesh into HDPE / Fiber containers containing outer Black polythene bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag and adjust the weights by using calibrated weighing balance.
steps.remarks: Check the integrity of the sieve and magnet of the Sifter after completion of sifting.

steps.description: If any damage is found, inform the Officer/HOD.
steps.remarks: If any foreign particles are found on the magnet, separate them; count its number and write details in the remarks column. Handover the particles in a self sealed cover to the concerned Officer / HOD. Integrity of Sieve & Magnets: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory

steps.description: Clean the outer surface of the containers with lint free cloth. Paste Internal Product labels on the packing containers.
Inform QC for sampling and complete analysis using the Finished Product Sample advice sheet.
steps.remarks: After QC sampling, Secure the inner and outer polythene bags with a cable tie and seal all the containers with a green seal and transfer them to the FP storage area.

verification_details.description: Is the Batch production record issued by QA ?
Are raw material input weights, in-house batch nos./A.R.Nos. recorded?
Are all approved raw materials used?
Are all operations performed, checked and signed?
Are all in-process testing reports attached to the batch production record?
Is temperature / vacuum data recorded in relevant columns of the BPR?
Is the yield of the product within the, expected yield range?
Is the yield of the product entered in the yield report?
Is the batch product passed as per relevant specifications?
If yes, are the deviations closed properly?
Are all.relevant ATR$ attached to the BPR?
